fields.tip: The last radio interview I did talked about the benefits of massage, but what we ended up speaking about was being clear in your communication with the therapist. They should always listen to your instruction, especially regarding pressure. If something is uncomfortable or doesn't feel right to you, please, please, please, tell your therapist!!!!
fields.title: Speak your mind

fields.tip: The seasons are about to change and the weather, in most parts of the country is about to turn cold. It's a time that the sinuses might need some extra help. Try washing out your nasal passages with a neti pot. The neti pot looks like a miniature teapot and uses saline solution to clean and soothe and the nose. Acupuncture is a great modality for preparing for the change of seasons. Go now, to start preparing for fall and winter weather changes. And have a healthy day!
fields.title: Breath Free

fields.tip: I find that when my body is feeling achy, often times it's just trying to get rid of toxins. Use a dry brush before your shower (brush the limbs towards the heart) and feel like a kitten. Use a natural salt or sugar scrub in the shower to top off the cleansing experience. Luxurious AND healthy!
fields.title: Feel like a cat

fields.tip: If you found that you overindulged in either food or drink, try taking the homeopathic Nux Vomica. I found it great for that over-do-it feeling. Take it before you go to bed and wake up feeling not quite so bad. Don't forget plenty of water!
fields.title: Had a bit too much?

fields.tip: I usually recommend that my clients cut out dairy, specifically milk. It is loaded full of hormones and antibiotics and is not as nutritious after being processed. If you need calcium and other minerals they can be gotten through increased consumption of veggies like spinach. I see many children suffering from chronic ear infections. Try taking them off cow's milk to see if it clears up.
fields.title: Got milk? Think again.

fields.tip: I see many men in my office complaing of low back and hip pain. Make sure you're not sitting on your wallet. It can throw your whole body out of balance. Keep in your briefcase, desk drawer or in your front pocket.
fields.title: Men. Low back pain?

fields.tip: Having trouble catching those zzz's? Try taking L-Tryptophan an essential amino acid that we don't always get enough of in our food. Always follow the instructions on the label and don't take if you are on SSRI's for depression. Sweet dreams!
fields.title: Trouble Sleeping?

fields.description: I am looking for venues to share my health and wellness knowledge. I'm an experienced speaker and seasoned practitioner. If you are having a health fair, women's gathering, etc and need a speaker, please feel free to contact me for more information. Thanks so much and feel free to spread the word!
fields.title: Want to learn about health and mind/body medicine

fields.description: A very informative and entertaining site sponsored by twin sisters, Kimberley and Alexandra. Email in a question and participate in the fun.
fields.site: Fun and Fit, Q and A with K and A
fields.title: Fun and Fit in 2010

fields.description: I was introduced to this product through a fellow Linked-In member. It looks facinating and promising. Watch this short video for more information. As a note, I am not affiliated with this company in any way and get no renumeration for promoting this product. I just think it might help people suffering from the effects of chemo.
fields.title: Help with chemotherapy

fields.description: For a healthy raw snack, check out Alyssa Boyle's Cavewoman Bars. These are tasty, affordable and good for you. I keep them in my car and in my drawer at the office in case I need a quick snack. Check them out and tell her that Kathy sent you!
fields.title: Need a healthy snack?

fields.description: A great source for high quality homeopathics. I've used their products for years and recommend them highly! Custom remedies available. Check it out!
fields.title: Homeopathic Care

fields.description: Learn about how you can take action to help keep our food supply safe and truthfully labeled. Sign up to receive updates about legislation and what is happening with additives and GMOs. Donate if you want to help support this fabulous organization, I do.
fields.title: Safe Food Now

fields.description: Fabulous, natural and amazing spices and teas. The owner is a gem and her products are incredible! Try them out and stop in to see her in Paso Robles. All natural, no preservatives, no MSG! Yes!
fields.title: Spice up your life

fields.description: The most amazing natural bath salts and scrubs I've ever used. The bath is my sanctuary and these products made it heaven. All natural and additive free. She also carries Shea Butter, lotions and room sprays. Check them out and you'll be clean and enlivened!
fields.title: Take the Waters

fields.description: Dr. Robert Puff and his co-host Elizabeth Lozano are doing a great job at bringing health and wellness education to the public. Their show The Holistic Success Show is well-made and informative. Dr. Puff's opening monologues are insightful and thought-provoking. And their guests are well-spoken and highly qualified. Check them out!
fields.title: Health TV online

fields.description: Head to page 58 to read my national article in Massage and Bodyworks magazine, on my experience with an IRS audit. This article is not written by an accountant or tax professional, but is my personal journey as a massage therapist to surviving an audit. I hope you never face that scary occurrence, but if you do, I hope this helps!
fields.title: Getting audited? Read my latest.

fields.description: Read my latest article on BigBlend magazine and listen in as I talk with Lisa and Nancy about the benefits of my favorite activity, massage.
fields.title: Besides feeling good, what are the benefits of massage?

fields.description: I was priviledged to have this except adapted from my book for use in BodySense Magazine, a division of Massage and Bodyworks. Enjoy!
fields.title: Excerpt from The Alternative Medicine Cabinet

fields.description:
This is what Dr. Nancy had to say about our recent radio interview and my book: 

Kathy Gruver's new book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet, is a wonderful addition to my health and wellness library. I recommend this easy-to-follow reference to everyone as a daily guide to maintain their own health naturally. I am honored to welcome her to the community of smart amazing women who have been our guests on WomenSpeak. Thank you Kathy for your good work. 

~Dr. Nancy D. O’Reilly, Clinical Psychologist, 
Psy.DFounder of WomenSpeak.com
fields.title: Words from Dr. Nancy

fields.description: Listen in on my interview with Dr. Nancy as we discuss ways that women can be healthier. It's a great time to start on a path to better health. How can I help?
fields.title: Learn health tips for busy women

fields.description: Read my latest article and listen in on my radio interview about Fibromyalgia.
fields.title: All about Fibromyalgia

fields.description: This is the master page from Big Blend Magazine where I am a featured writer and radio guest. At the bottom of the page there are links to my past interviews and articles. Please check them out and feel free to email me with any questions or requests. Thanks for looking!
fields.title: A bevy of information about natural health

fields.description: Read Kathy's latest article on cleansing the body and why it's beneficial. At the bottom of the page is a link to her radio interview covering the same topic. Thanks for looking and have a healthy day!
fields.title: Cleansing the Body

fields.source: Dr. Nancy D. O’Reilly, Clinical Psychologist, Psy.D, Founder of www.WomenSpeak.com
fields.description: Kathy Gruver's new book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet, is a wonderful addition to my health and wellness library. I recommend this easy-to-follow reference to everyone as a daily guide to maintain their own health naturally. I am honored to welcome her to the community of smart amazing women who have been our guests on WomenSpeak. Thank you Kathy for your good work.

I found the book to be inspiring and one thing I really enjoyed was the positive attitude” message. Dr. Gruver makes it abundantly clear that our minds have a lot of power in our lives. As the saying goes, “you are what you eat,” we are reminded in this book that we are what we think too.

The author has a sensible writing style, easy to read, understand and easy to follow ideas and solutions, most of which I would say are preventative measures. When I sat down to look at this book I was taken in right away and ended up reading the whole thing in one sitting.

This is a great book and guide for someone who wants to learn how to take charge of their own health in a natural way, ways to boost our immunity and how to empower ourselves to be an active participant in our own medical/health lives. I thoroughly enjoyed the book and I will surely be referring to it again and again.
This book was really good...It's a great book to give to your Western doctor to enlighten them about other remedies for cancer, high blood pressure, or indigestion.

If you’re just learning about Alternative Medicine or are seeking a quickie review of the subject, Gruver’s book will give you enough to swallow and digest. It’s a worthwhile guide for those interested in navigating the complex waters of alternative medicine.
Not only does Gruver’s book introduce you to a wide range of alternative remedies, it also delves into health tips you can practice, to achieve improved health.

This book is a straight to the point resource for all considering small lifestyle changes for better health. I found it most helpful that it wasn't written in hard-to-pronounce words and was applicable for even the most novice of alternative patients.

fields.source: Men and Health: It's a guy thing (blog by Scott Keith)
fields.description: Gruver's compact guide to Alternative Medicine is great for people "on the fence" or not quite sure whether to embrace the idea. It's a chance to open your eyes to remedies that, in some cases, rely on ingredients direct from earth.

If you are looking for a way to handle your health in a natural way, then the book, The Alternative Medicine Cabinet is a must read. This book is a true resource to any health circumstances you might be encountering and breaks down alternative medicine. Kathy is very knowledgeable of natural and holistic living.

I liked that so many of her suggestions were easy to incorporate and implement; making
it easy for young and old! She presents so many aspects of achieving good health that
I applaud her ability to explain it and organize it so easily. As a professional I learned
more about natural ways to help patients. This book continues to provide resources and
education for those who want to help themselves. Her message on how to change is
inspiring.

I love her little book. Basically Gruver covers all the important aspects. Gruver’s
knowledge and expertise shines through by giving the skeptic food for thought (pun
intended)

I do feel this would be the perfect book to have on hand or give as a gift to those
unfamiliar with the holistic field of natural medicine. The information is invaluable
to anyone. It serves as a good reminder even to the current holistic professional
to make sure they also take care of themselves, as well as those in their care.

Gruver has packed an enormous amount of information, including massage, herbs,
homeopathy and lifestyle tips and information, into a small, easily referenced book
that should not only be at every bedside/bathroom table, but in every kitchen as well.

The Alternative Medicine Cabinet is a read well worth considering for those who
embrace new age and alternative medicines.

The Alternative Medicine Cabinet is an easy read, but packed with information that everyone should know. This book is well written, covers a lot of information without being boring and is very easy to navigate. If you are interested in natural health to treat your ailments and illnesses, this book would be great for you.

I enjoyed the recent NAWBO presentation on health issues, moderated by KathyGruver, MS, LMT, RM, Reiki Master and Naturopath. Wow! Great lively, veryinformative presentation! 

The three discussed the connection between body, mind and spirit to help us uncover things about ourselves thatwe might not have thought about before. There were periods of silence and harmony, exercises that stretched and strengthened our bodies and lively information sharing. Great and stimulating moderation, too. Kathy not only shared so much, but kept everything alive, helpful and fun.

fields.source: Elizabeth Lozano, M.A., LMFT- The Holistic Success Show
fields.description: Kathy Gruver is an intelligent, well spoken and passionate woman who knows what she's talking about!  It was such an honor to have her as a guest on our show. She was comfortable on camera, conversational, knowledgeable, and confident.  She really helped us teach our viewers some important things they need to know that can help them tremendously.  If you are looking for a great speaker, on camera or off- I highly recommend Kathy Gruver- you won't be disappointed!

fields.source: Steven Brynoff, ND, President Mediral Homeopathics
fields.description: I was privileged to sit in on Dr. Gruver’s lecture at the 2010 ANMA Annual Convention, ‘How our words affect our health.’  Her casual, confident speaking style combined with her signature sense of humor made for an informative and enjoyable presentation.  Very knowledgeable.  Examples from her practice were particularly helpful, and suggestions were effective and quick to implement.  Easily one of the finest speakers on the natural health circuit, someone to watch with eager anticipation.

fields.source: Cathy Feldman,  Program Co-Chair,  National Association of Women Business Owners, Santa Barbara
fields.description: Kathy Gruver's informative and fun workshop on Wellness and the Working Woman for NAWBO-SB was terrific.  Full of great advice on nutrition, balancing our lives as well as some easy exercises we can do throughout the day to keep us limber and well, it was a worthwhile and thoroughly professional presentation.  Thank you, Kathy.

fields.source: Dawn Hampton , President,  National Association of Women Business Owners, Santa Barbara
fields.description: Kathy Gruver has spoken to the National Association of Women Business Owner’s, Santa Barbara Chapter on Wellness for the Working Woman: How to Take Back Your Health and Slow Down the Aging Process. She entertains and educates and is a phenomenal speaker providing her audience with many ah-ha moments about their life and health.

fields.source: Attendee at NAWBO SB, Wellness for the Working Woman lecture
fields.description: Great workshop! Lots of information I knew and lots that I didn’t. Very well presented!

fields.source: Michelle Profant,  President , Santa Barbara Northside Optimist Club
fields.description: On behalf of the Santa Barbara Northside Optimist Club, let me thank you again for speaking to our group. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed your talk on the mind/body connection and how we can all play a greater role in our wellness. Your ability to explain the sometimes complicated components of health including facts along with some humor is a rare quality. You did an excellent job in conveying the key elements that we all can benefit from knowing.

fields.source: Beverly Mineo, National Sales Manager Canary Hotel, Santa Barbara, CA
fields.description: Recently I had the pleasure of hearing Kathy speak on the body and mind connection in achieving and maintaining good health. I found the presentation to be fascinating, educational and especially inspiring. She has a rare talent of including humor in motivating and inspiring your audience. I am involved with several groups that book speakers for seminars and other events and will be recommending Kathy to them. Thank you for such a powerful presentation, I immediately began replacing negative thoughts with positive ones!

fields.source: Lisa Smith, Publisher at Big Blend Magazine
fields.description: Besides keeping our readers informed on natural health and alternative medicine with her popular monthly column in BigBlendMagazine.com, Kathy Gruver is an excellent radio guest who joins us frequently on Big Blend Radio’s ‘Ultimate Living’ quality of life radio show. She not only provides our listeners with the information they need when it comes to keeping their health in check, but she is well-spoken, entertaining, and professional in every sense of the word. After listening to her speak, you will find yourself motivated about being healthy and excited to take care of your body!
I wasn't sure what to expect but I learned a lot. Kathy made the lecture both fun and informative.
Kathy could even make pathology fun.

Kathy approaches her lectures with the ability to relate very well to her audience. Not only is she extremely knowledgeable about health issues, she has a great sense of humor which puts the audience at ease, and therefore more willing to hear and process her valuable information.
Super inspirational reminder of what we need to practice daily. Please pass on my comments and compliments and gratitude to our speaker!

fields.source: Lesa Caputo, Brown and Brown Insurance
fields.description: Thanks so much for the inspiring, educational and deeply thought provoking presentation you made this morning on Women’s Health in the Workplace.  As a constantly emotionally and physically depleted working mom with a very successful and highly stressful business that I juggle with the care giving of 3 small children under the age of 6 at home, there was so much that I took away from this morning that I literally cannot wait to get started!  I am motivated, I am committed and I have you to thank for the profound reminder of the vows I need to make to myself above all others that make their demands on me daily. Bless you.
